definitions.example: She trained seven hours a day to prepare for the Olympics.

definitions.definition: To teach and form (someone) by practice; to educate (someone).
definitions.example: You can't train a pig to write poetry.
I trained with weights all winter.

definitions.definition: To move (a gun) laterally so that it points in a different direction.
definitions.example: The assassin had trained his gun on the minister.

definitions.definition: To encourage (a plant or branch) to grow in a particular direction or shape, usually by pruning and bending.
definitions.example: The vine had been trained over the pergola.

definitions.definition: To trace (a lode or any mineral appearance) to its head.
To create a trainer for; to apply cheats to (a game).
To draw along; to trail; to drag.
To draw by persuasion, artifice, or the like; to attract by stratagem; to entice; to allure.
Having undergone a course of training (sometimes in combination).
